meanings.definition: To broadcast simultaneously on multiple platforms.
meanings.sent1: During the game, they simulcasted it on TV and online.
meanings.sent2: The news was simulcasted on both the radio and the internet.
meanings.sent3: The magician simulcasted his disappearing act on all screens at once.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter simulcasted joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was simulcasted in high definition for a breathtaking experience.

meanings.definition: The act of broadcasting a program on television and radio at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The simulcasted event reached a wide audience.
meanings.sent2: I watched the simulcasted concert from the comfort of my home.
meanings.sent3: The simulcasted show made it easy for everyone to tune in.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a simulcasted success on both TV and radio.
meanings.sent5: The simulcasted broadcast brought the community together for a shared experience.
